alert.note: Alert for Humboldt County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 3:48PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Humboldt County through 415 PM PDT... At 347 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles west of Kings River Valley, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Humboldt County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
